0.name: The Fool
0.upright: Beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, a free spirit
0.description: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe.
0.symbolism: The sun rising up behind, white rose, cliff edge, small dog or wolf

1.name: The Magician
1.description: The Magician represents your ability to communicate clearly, to 'sell' yourself and to be innovative. The Magician has all the tools and resources available to manifest his desired outcome.
1.symbolism: Infinity symbol, ouroboros belt, hands raised to heaven and pointed to earth

2.name: The High Priestess
2.upright: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, the subconscious mind
2.reversed: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal and silence
2.description: The High Priestess signifies spiritual enlightenment, inner illumination, divine knowledge and wisdom. She represents the mysterious, the hidden and the intuitive aspects of the feminine.
2.symbolism: Moon crescent, pillars, veil, pomegranates, torah scroll

3.name: The Empress
3.reversed: Creative block, dependence on others, emptiness
3.description: The Empress represents a strong connection with our femininity. Femininity translates in many ways â€“ beauty, nurturing, expression, creativity, and abundance.
3.symbolism: Venus symbol, stars on crown, water flowing, abundant nature

4.name: The Emperor
4.upright: Authority, establishment, structure, a father figure
4.description: The Emperor represents a powerful influence, authority, and structure in the querent's life. He symbolizes rulership, regulation, organization, and governance of the material world.
4.symbolism: Ram heads, orb and scepter, red robe, stone throne

5.name: The Hierophant
5.upright: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, institutions
5.reversed: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo
5.description: The Hierophant represents the need to conform to societal rules or norms, whether religious or cultural.
5.symbolism: Papal cross, triple crown, pillars, kneeling figures

6.name: The Lovers
6.upright: Love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, choices
6.reversed: Self-love, disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values
6.description: The Lovers represents perfect union, harmony, love and attraction. The Lovers can represent finding the balance within oneself.
6.symbolism: Adam and Eve, angel Raphael, tree of knowledge, tree of life, snake

7.name: The Chariot
7.description: The Chariot represents overcoming obstacles through determination, willpower, and strength of character. It indicates a need to push forward and take control of the situation.
7.symbolism: Armor, chariot, sphinxes or horses, wand, star crown

8.name: Strength
8.reversed: Inner strength, self-doubt, low energy, raw emotion
8.description: Strength represents inner strength, patience, compassion, soft control, and resilience. It suggests that you need to draw on your inner reserves of strength and confidence.
8.symbolism: Lion, infinity symbol, woman in white

9.name: The Hermit
9.upright: Soul-searching, introspection, being alone, inner guidance
9.description: The Hermit suggests that you are in a phase of introspection where you are drawing your attention inwards and looking for answers within.
9.symbolism: Lantern, staff, grey cloak, mountain peak

10.name: Wheel of Fortune
10.upright: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, a turning point
10.reversed: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles
10.description: The Wheel of Fortune represents good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, and a turning point. It reminds us that all things are constantly changing.
10.symbolism: Wheel, sphinx, snake, angel, eagle, bull, lion

11.name: Justice
11.upright: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law
11.description: Justice represents fairness, balance, and the consequences of our actions. It suggests that the universe will restore equilibrium and deliver outcomes that reflect the energy we put into the world.

12.name: The Hanged Man
12.upright: Pause, surrender, letting go, new perspectives
12.description: The Hanged Man represents a time of pause, surrender, and seeing situations from a new perspective. It indicates a period of suspension and limbo.
12.symbolism: Inverted man, T-shaped cross, halo, right angle with legs

13.name: Death
13.reversed: Resistance to change, inability to move on
13.description: Death represents the end of a cycle and the beginning of new one, signifying transformation and renewal. It does not typically represent physical death.
13.symbolism: Skeleton in armor, scythe, dying king, bishop, child, sunrise

14.name: Temperance
14.description: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and harmony. It suggests finding middle ground and avoiding extremes in any situation.
14.symbolism: Angel, water and fire mixing, pathway, crown

15.name: The Devil
15.upright: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, sexuality
15.reversed: Releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment
15.description: The Devil represents our shadow side and the negative force of addiction, depression, and dependency. It often represents feeling trapped by circumstances or patterns.
15.symbolism: Horned figure, inverted pentagram, chained figures, bat wings

16.name: The Tower
16.upright: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening
16.reversed: Personal transformation, fear of change, averting disaster
16.description: The Tower represents sudden upheaval, disaster, and crisis. It suggests that dramatic change is occurring or imminent, often in an unexpected way.
16.symbolism: Lightning, burning tower, people falling, crown

17.name: The Star
17.reversed: Lack of faith, despair, self-trust, disconnection
17.description: The Star represents hope, faith, and spiritual abundance. It suggests rejuvenation, serenity, and optimism for the future.
17.symbolism: Star, water, bird, naked woman, water jugs

18.name: The Moon
18.reversed: Release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion
18.description: The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and the subconscious. It suggests uncertainty, confusion, and the need to trust your instincts in ambiguous situations.
18.symbolism: Moon, wolf and dog, crayfish, towers, path

19.name: The Sun
19.reversed: Inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic
19.description: The Sun represents success, joy, and positive outcomes. It suggests fulfillment, happiness, and the warmth of accomplishment.
19.symbolism: Sun with face, sunflowers, child on horse, red banner

20.name: Judgement
20.reversed: Self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call
20.description: Judgement represents awakening, renewal, and evaluation. It suggests a period of self-assessment and facing the consequences of past actions.
20.symbolism: Angel with trumpet, rising figures from graves

21.name: The World
21.description: The World represents completion, fulfillment, and the successful conclusion of a cycle. It suggests wholeness, harmony, and ultimate achievement.
21.symbolism: Dancing figure, wreath, four elements (bull, lion, eagle, human)

three_card.name: Three Card Spread
three_card.description: A basic three-card spread that represents the past, present, and future of a situation or question.

celtic_cross.name: Celtic Cross
celtic_cross.description: A ten-card spread that provides a comprehensive view of influences surrounding the querent, including past and future events, obstacles, and hopes.

relationship.name: Relationship Spread
relationship.description: A six-card spread designed to explore the dynamics between two people.

career.name: Career Path
career.description: A five-card spread focusing on career development and professional growth.

stellar.name: Stellar Tarot
stellar.description: A premium seven-card spread exclusive to AIArcana token holders, providing deep insight into all aspects of life.
